title: Banana Oats Smoothie
description: A quick, nutritious smoothie packed with protein and immunity-boosting ingredients. Great for busy mornings and loved by kids and adults alike.
steps: Place all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Garnish with dry fruits and serve.

title: Aloo ka Paratha Dhaba Style
description: A delicious and spicy stuffed potato flatbread, cooked Dhaba-style. Perfect for breakfast or any meal, served hot with curd, chutney, or tea.
steps: Mash the boiled potatoes well and add salt to taste.
Grind cumin, black pepper, and coriander coarsely.
Add the crushed spices and chopped coriander leaves to the potatoes.
Crush garlic and ginger together and mix into the potato filling.
Add dry mango powder, garam masala, and turmeric. Mix everything well.
Prepare a soft dough using wheat flour.
Take a dough ball, stuff it with the potato mixture, and seal the edges.
Roll the stuffed dough into a flat paratha using some flour.
Heat a pan, add ghee, and cook the paratha until light golden pink on both sides.
Serve hot with chutney or curd.

title: Paneer Tikka Masala
description: A rich and flavorful North Indian dish made with marinated paneer and a creamy spiced tomato-onion gravy. A crowd favorite served best with naan or roti.
steps: Mix yogurt with all marination ingredients. Add paneer, capsicum, and onion cubes. Marinate for 30 minutes.
Boil chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Fry cashews and peanuts. Grind both with the onion mixture.
Grind tomatoes and green chillies separately.
Heat oil and sauté the onion-nut paste. Add tomato paste and cook well.
Add spices and water. Simmer, then add cream.
Shallow-fry marinated paneer and veggies.
Add them to the gravy, garnish with coriander, and serve with roti or naan.

title: Egg Curry
description: A rich and flavorful egg curry made with golden-fried eggs simmered in a spiced onion-tomato gravy. Perfect with hot parathas, rice, or roti.
steps: Boil the eggs for 20 minutes, then peel and set aside.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the eggs until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
In the same oil, add cumin seeds and bay leaves. Fry until aromatic.
Add chopped onions and fry until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add red chili, turmeric, coriander powder, garam masala, black pepper, and salt. Sauté until oil separates.
Add Kasuri Methi and mix well.
Add a little water and bring to a boil.
Add the fried eggs, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Turn off the heat, garnish with coriander leaves, and serve with roti, rice, or paratha.

title: Strawberry Smoothie
description: A refreshing and fruity smoothie made with fresh strawberries, curd, and milk. Perfect for kids, guests, and summer days.
steps: Blend strawberries, curd, milk, and sugar together until smooth.
Add ice cubes to a glass.
Pour the blended smoothie into the glass.
Garnish with strawberry slices and serve chilled.

title: Modak
description: A traditional Indian sweet made of coconut and jaggery filling inside soft rice flour shells. Especially prepared for Lord Ganesha during Ganesh Chaturthi.
steps: Dry roast the grated coconut and keep it aside.
Boil water and add jaggery. Cook until it thickens.
Add the roasted coconut and cardamom powder to the jaggery mixture. Mix well and set aside.
Mix rice flour with hot water, oil, and salt. Knead into smooth dough.
Make small balls, stuff with the filling, and shape into modaks.
Steam modaks until cooked and offer to Ganpati Bappa.

title: Baby Potato Fry
description: A quick, spicy, and flavorful potato dish made with baby potatoes and Indian spices. Perfect as a side dish or quick snack!
steps: Wash baby potatoes and pressure cook for 2 whistles. Peel carefully.
Mix with turmeric, chili powder, cumin powder, salt, and a little oil. Rest for 10 minutes.
Heat oil, add mustard and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add marinated potatoes, stir well, and cook covered on low heat for 8–10 minutes.
Sprinkle chaat masala and serve hot.

title: Mango Barfi
description: A rich and fruity Indian sweet made with ripe mangoes, coconut, and sugar. Perfect for summer celebrations and festive occasions.
steps: Peel and chop mangoes, then blend with sugar and cornflour.
Dry roast coconut for 2 minutes and set aside.
Cook mango pulp until it thickens and changes color slightly.
Add coconut and cook until thick enough to set.
Grease a tray with ghee, pour in the mixture, and flatten.
Top with cashews and pistachios. Press gently and let it set for 1 hour.
Cut into pieces and serve.

title: Delicious Pakoras
description: Crispy, spicy pakoras made with potatoes, onions, and a flavorful blend of Indian spices — perfect for rainy days and family snacking.
steps: Combine all chopped ingredients and spices with gram flour.
Mix and let rest for 2 minutes.
Heat oil, drop spoonfuls of mixture into hot oil, and fry until golden.
Serve hot with green chutney or ketchup.

title: Malai Pista Kulfi
description: A rich and creamy frozen dessert made with milk, sugar, pistachios, and cardamom. A classic Indian treat loved by all ages.
steps: Boil milk on medium flame until it thickens.
Add sugar and stir until dissolved.
Mix in cream, pistachios, and cardamom powder. Turn off heat.
Cool completely and pour into kulfi molds.
Freeze for at least 8 hours. Unmold and serve chilled.

title: Healthy Wood Apple Juice
description: A refreshing and medicinal summer drink made from ripe bael (wood apple), known for its digestive and cooling properties.
steps: Break the bael and scoop out the pulp.
Add water and let soak for 2 hours.
Mash the pulp and strain using a sieve to remove seeds and fibers.
Add sugar to taste and stir well.
Chill and serve the refreshing bael juice.
